instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean ME BIOS image required
threads.message:
Hi guys, I got this 12 inch 2017 macbook with a totally destroyed BIOS chip... so I cannot read it and therefor cant flash it in a new chip..

I found some .bin files for this motherboard on the internet but unfortunately they are not working...
Any help will be much appreciated

Thanks !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean ME BIOS image required
threads.message:
Try this one:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vXH8vV9TcC_2l_AhMrkDto0hqm2F11Ze/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Be aware, that you may have a bad CPU; classic problem for all <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean ME BIOS image required
threads.message:
Thank you very very much ! Its working.
Now it looks like I need to reinstall the OS. but it boots perfect with external HD.

Cheers !
